info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 09 at 9:23PM AST until September 12 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST MONDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 and 10 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along St Croix Eastern Half. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Monday night. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM AST Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents that can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water where it becomes difficult to return to safety. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...It is very likely that the High Rip Current Risk statements and High Surf Advisories might be extended through most of next week as Hurricane Lee continues moving northward over the western Atlantic.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.
